metadata.title: CVE-2013-4359 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in kbdint.c in mod_sftp in ProFTPD 1.3.4d and 1.3.5r3allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption)via a large response count value in an authentication request, whichtriggers a large memory allocation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4359` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

proftpd-basic - 1.3.5~rc3-2.1
proftpd-mod-geoip - 1.3.5~rc3-2.1
proftpd-mod-ldap - 1.3.5~rc3-2.1
proftpd-mod-mysql - 1.3.5~rc3-2.1
proftpd-mod-odbc - 1.3.5~rc3-2.1
proftpd-mod-pgsql - 1.3.5~rc3-2.1
proftpd-mod-sqlite - 1.3.5~rc3-2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: proftpd-dfsg package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.5~rc3-2.1').
